ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I will force him to climb a fiery slope.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I shall inflict on him hardship,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: I shall soon constrain him to a hard ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We shall make him suffer the torment of hell without relief.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Soon I shall mount him on Saood, the hill of fire.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: I shall force him to Sa`ud!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: I will make a distressing punishment overtake him.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and I shall constrain him to a hard ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: On him I shall impose a fearful doom.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: I shall force him to endure a painful uphill climb!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Anon I shall afflict him with a fearful woe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Soon I will overwhelm him with hardship.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Soon will I visit him with a mount of calamities!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: I shall oblige him to (climb a slippery mountain in the Hell-fire called As-Sa'ud, or to) face a severe torment!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: I will constrain him to a hard ascent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: I will cover him with arduous torment.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [74:17] [Soon] I shall burden him with a trying chastisement; alternatively [sa‘ūdan means] a mountain of fire which he will be made to ascend and then fall down from, forever.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (On him I shall impose a fearful doom) I shall make him climb a smooth rock in the Fire such that whenever he puts his hands on it, he wwould melt, and then he will be restored to how he used to be; it is also said that Allah will make him climb a rock of copper which pulls him from the front and hits him from the back.
